alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Franklin; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 4:21AM EDT until August 28 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Floyd County in southwestern Virginia... Northeastern Patrick County in southwestern Virginia... West Central Franklin County in west central Virginia... * Until noon EDT Monday. * At 421 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woolwine... Copper Hill... Endicott... Charity... Callaway... Buffalo Ridge... This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Sycamore Creek, Dodd Creek, Little Goblintown Creek, Hatchet Creek, North Fork Blackwater River, Jacks Creek, Meadow Creek, Dan River, Ivy Creek, Little Creek, Meadow Run, Lick Fork, Little River, Boothe Creek, Blackwater River, Goblintown Creek and Joint Crack Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
